page.title: 18INTERVIEW WITH A LOCAL
page.content: The population of Watchfield during the second world war was very large because there used to be an airfield at the edge of Watchfield .Mr. Curtis said that first the airfield was once used for joy rides but the paratroopers took over at the beginning of the war.It was a lot quieter after the war.The airfield was not used for long and it soon fell into disrepair and was pulled down.Now the land is being sold.In fact the bypass was built on part of the old airfield. Mr. Curtis was awarded the British Empire Medal by the Queen in 1981 for services to Watchfield and the community.
